conbody.p: When something goes wrong, an Error object will be returned into the callback passed to the operation. This Error object contains a lot of information that can be helpful to identify what went wrong. Logging this object will typically contain a stack trace as well as contain the error code and message that was generated within libcouchbase.

An Error object contains all of the default JavaScript error properties, but is also enhanced with a numeric code value which is represents the error encountered within libcouchbase. This error code can be used for quick identification of errors and easier error handling.
